profile_data.summary:
*AI/ML leader with 9+ years of post-Ph.D. industry experience across retail, rail, cruise, airlines, hospitality, and automobile.
*5+ years of experience managing data/applied scientists, data engineers, and business intelligence engineers.
*Led the design and implementation of large-scale production systems that have driven billions of dollars in revenue growth.
*Accomplished researcher with numerous publications across application of AI/ML in logistics and revenue management.
profile_data.headline: AI / ML Leader @ Amazon

experience.description:
1. Leading a team of data scientists, data engineers, and business intelligence engineers to deliver machine learning and optimization-based solutions across supply chain planning, vendor profitability, and Spanish language customer experience
2. Working with business and leadership team to understand business problems and design Machine Learning and Generative AI products to solve them
3. Providing technical leadership through design, code, and document reviews
4. Managing career development and work/life balance for high performing scientists and engineers
experience.title: Research Science Manager, North America Stores Expansion

experience.description:
1. Designed and prototyped new features in multi-echelon planning buying algorithms
2. Product owner for buying schedule, anomaly detection, import buying, and sub-same day fulfillment 
3. Extensively used simulation and production labs to test and roll out new features
4. Deep dived into product groups where out of stock rates were high and identified areas of improvement through model enhancements
experience.title: Senior Product Manager - Tech, Supply Chain Optimization Technologies

experience.description:
1. Led the data science team of the rail & cruise vertical in the design and configuration of revenue management systems for various Fortune 500 companies.
2. Led the design of our first product in passenger rail, resulting in 2.8% revenue uplift for our launch customer in the U.K.
3. Working on numerous machine learning and optimization models for demand forecasting and price & inventory optimization
○	Examples include network optimization, time-series forecasting, XGBoost, and random forest
4. Mentoring and training scientists and other cross functional resources in our vertical
5. Responsible for recruiting talented scientists to fuel the growth of our vertical
experience.title: Director of Science

experience.description:
1. Played a key role in the design and implementation of a revenue management system for Carnival Cruise Lines
○	Worked with Carnival brands across U.S., U.K., Germany, and Australia 
○	Selected as a Franz Edelman finalist alongside companies such as Amazon, IBM, Intel, Walmart, & Deutsche Bahn
2. Designed a real-time price optimization service which is being used by 800+ hotels of a global hotel company
3. Extensively used the following software to build various analytical models: Python, R, Cplex, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server
4. Coached operations research consultants and helped them accelerate their growth in the firm
experience.title: Senior Consultant, Operations Research

experience.description:
1. Designed various machine learning based models and optimization techniques to maximize revenue growth
2. Examples include prediction models for price elasticity, customer churn, and a quadratic program to maximize revenue
3. Started a public speaking club in the company for the professional development of employees
experience.title: Consultant, Operations Research

projects.description:
- Generated flight schedules and itineraries based upon a hub-and-spoke system
- Created a mixed-integer-linear programming formulation for revenue maximization
- Implemented the algorithm in MATLAB and used realistic data to run the model
projects.title: Flight Scheduling: Revenue Maximization

member.occupation: Trans-Atlantic Network Planning at Delta Air Lines

projects.description:
- Analyzed bin picking operation in an automobile service parts distribution center
- Derived algorithm that maximizes picks per hour in bin picking area by rerouting pick path and rearranging bay locations
- Proposed alternative with 14.8% improvement in pick lines per hour
projects.title: Mobis Parts America Project

projects.description:
- Developed a decision making model for the Indian Paper Industry
- Used Linear Physical Programming to select efficient collection centers
- Used Fuzzy Logic and Bayesian Updating to determine whether remanufacturing is better or recycling
projects.title: A Holistic Approach for Modeling and Analyzing Reverse Logistics
